title: The One Where Underdog Gets Away

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is confronting her boss, Terry.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Terry, I, I, I know that I haven't worked here very long, but I was wondering, do you think it would be possible if I got a $100 advance in my salary?

dialogue.speaker: TERRY
dialogue.text: An advance?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: It's so that I can spend Thanksgiving with my family. See, every year we go skiing in Vail, and normally my father pays for my ticket, but I sort of started the whole independence thing, you know, which is actually why I took this job.

dialogue.speaker: TERRY
dialogue.text: Rachel, Rachel, sweetheart. You're a terrible, terrible waitress. Really, really awful.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, I, I hear what you're sayin'. I'm with you. Um, but I, but I'm trying really hard. And I think I'm doing better. I really do. Does anybody need coffee? (everyone in the place raises their hand) Oh, look at that.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is confronting her boss, Terry.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is approaching a customer.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Excuse me, sir. Hi, you come in here all time. I was just wondering, do you think there's a possibility that you could give me an advance on my tips?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, ok, that's fine. Fine. Hey, I'm sorry about that spill before. (picks up the tip he leaves) Only $98.50 to go.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey. Ross, did you know Mom and Dad are going to Puerto Rico for Thanksgiving?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, they're not.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes, they are. The Blymens invited them.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're wrong.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I am not wrong.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're wrong.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, I just talked to them.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (getting up, upset) I'm calling Mom.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And this from the cry-for-help department. Are you wearing makeup?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yes, I am. As of today, I am officially Joey Tribbiani, actor slash model.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's so funny, 'cause I was thinking you look more like Joey Tribbiani, man slash woman.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What were you modeling for?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You know those posters for the city free clinic?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, wow, so you're gonna be one of those "healthy, healthy, healthy guys"?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know, the asthma guy was really cute.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Do you know which one you're gonna be?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, but I hear lyme disease is open, so... (crosses fingers)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Good luck, man. I hope you get it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Well, you were right. How can they do this to us, huh? It's Thanksgiving.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok, I'll tell you what. How about I cook dinner at my place? I'll make it just like Mom's.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Will you make the mashed potatoes with the lumps?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, they're not actually supposed to have... (Ross looks at her sheepishly) I'll work on the lumps. Joey, you're going home, right?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And I assume, Chandler, you are still boycotting all the pilgrim holidays.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, every single one of them.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe, you're gonna be with your grandma?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, and her boyfriend. But we're celebrating Thanksgiving in December 'cause he is lunar.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So you're free Thursday, then.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Oh, can I come?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah. Rach, are you thinking you're gonna make it to Vail?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Absolutely. Shoop, shoop, shoop. Only a hundred and two dollars to go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I thought it was $98.50.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, well it was. I, I broke a cup.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I'm off to Carol's.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, ooh! Why don't we invite her?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (mimicking) Ooh, ooh. Because she's my ex-wife, and will probably want to bring her, ooh, ooh, lesbian life partner.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is approaching a customer.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan's apartment, Susan is there. Ross enters.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi, is uh, is Carol here?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: No, she's at a faculty meeting.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I uh, just came by to pick up my skull. Well, not mine,

dialogue.speaker: BUT... SUSAN
dialogue.text: Come in.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks. Yeah, Carol borrowed it for a class, and I have to get it back to the museum.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: What's it look like?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Kinda like a big face without skin.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm familiar with the concept. We can just look for it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok. (browsing the apartment) Wow, you guys sure have a lot of books about bein' a lesbian.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Well, you know, you have to take a course. Otherwise, they don't let you do it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (picking up a book) Hey, hey, Yertle the Turtle. A classic.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Actually, I'm reading it to the baby.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The uh, the baby that hasn't been born yet? Wouldn't that mean you're... crazy?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: What, you don't think they can hear sounds in there?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're not serious, I mean, you really... you really talk to it?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, all the time. I want the baby to know my voice.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Do you uh, do you talk about me?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, all the time.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: But um, we just refer to you as Bobo the Sperm Guy.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan's apartment, Susan is there. Ross enters.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there but Rachel.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, if she's talking to it, I just think that I should get some belly time too. Not that I believe any of this.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I believe it. I think the baby can totally hear everything. I can show you. Look, this will seem a little weird, but you put your head inside this turkey, and then we'll all talk, and you'll hear everything we say.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'd just like to say that I'm totally behind this experiment. In fact, I'd very much like to butter your head.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, Rach, did you make your money?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, not even close. Forget Vail, forget seeing my family, forget shoop, shoop, shoop.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rach, here's your mail.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thanks, you can just put it on the table.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (insistently) No, here's your mail.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thanks, you can just put it on the table.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (gives her an envelope) Would you just open it?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my god, oh, you guys are great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We all chipped in.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Monica) We did?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Joey) You owe me 20 bucks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you. Thank you so much!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (hands Chandler a bag) Chandler, here you go, got your traditional Thanksgiving feast, you got your tomato soup, your grilled cheese fixin's, and your family size bag of Funyuns.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, Chandler, this is what you're havin' for Thanksgiving dinner? What, what, what is it with you and this holiday?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right, I'm nine years old.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I hate this story.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We just finished this magnificent Thanksgiving dinner. I have--and I remember this part vividly--a mouthful of pumpkin pie, and this is the moment my parents choose to tell me they're getting divorced.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes. It's very difficult to appreciate a Thanksgiving dinner once you've seen it in reverse.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there but Rachel.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The subway, Joey spots a gorgeous woman waiting. He goes up to her.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, hi. We uh, we used to work together.

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: We did?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, at Macy's. You were the Obsession girl, right? I was the Aramis guy. (pretends to spray cologne) Aramis? Aramis?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Yeah, right.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I gotta tell you. You're the best in the business.

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Get out.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm serious. You're amazing. You know when to spritz, when to lay back.

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Really? You don't know what that means to me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ooh, you smell great tonight. What're you wearing?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: (provocatively) Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Listen, uh, you wanna go get a drink or something?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Yeah. (she gets up, notices something behind Joey) Oh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What's wrong?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: I just remembered, I have to do something.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh. What?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Um, leave.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait!

dialogue.speaker: IN THE SUBWAY. THE POSTER SAYS
dialogue.text: What Mario isn't telling you...V.D., you never know who might have it. A variety of scenes are shown with the poster displayed all over New York City.)

subjects: IN THE SUBWAY. THE POSTER SAYS
scenes.event_description: [Scene: The subway, Joey spots a gorgeous woman waiting. He goes up to her.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey enters, amongst snickers from the gang.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So I guess you all saw it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Saw what?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, we were just laughing. You know, how laughter can be infectious.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey enters, amongst snickers from the gang.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey enters, upset.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Set another place for Thanksgiving. My entire family thinks I have VD.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Tonight, on a very special Blossom.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey enters, upset.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is cooking Thanksgiving dinner. Chandler is
standing in the doorway, not wanting to participate in the festivities.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Mmm, looking good. Ok, cider's mulling, turkey's turking, yams are yamming. (notices Ross is depressed) What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know. It's just not the same without Mom in the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, that's it. You know what? Just get out of my way and stop moping.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's closer.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I got the tickets! I got the tickets! Five hours from now, shoop, shoop, shoop.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, you must stop shooping.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, I'm gonna get my stuff.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Chandler, will you just come in already?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, I prefer to keep a safe distance from all this merriment.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Look out, incoming pumpkin pie!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, we all laughed when you did it with the stuffing, but that's not funny anymore.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Monica, I got a question. I don't see any tater tots.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's not a question.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But my mom always makes them. It's like a tradition. You get a little piece of turkey on your fork, a little cranberry sauce, and a tot! It's bad enough I can't be with my family because of my disease.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, fine. Tonight's potatoes will be both mashed with lumps, and in the form of tots.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, I'm off to talk to my unborn child.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ah!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, Mom never hit.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (stirring pot) Ok, all done.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What, Phoebe, did you whip the potatoes? Ross needs lumps!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry, oh, I just, I thought we could have them whipped and then add some peas and onions.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why would we do that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, 'cause then they'd be like my mom used to make them, you know, before she died.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok, three kinds of potatoes coming up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, good-bye you guys. Thanks for everything. (she starts to leave, and hits everyone with her skis) Oh, sorry! Oh, sorry!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The most unbelievable thing has happened. Underdog has just gotten away.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The balloon?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, the actual cartoon character. Of course the balloon. It's all over the news. Right before he reached Macy's , he broke free and was spotted flying over Washington Square Park. I'm goin' to the roof, who's with me?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can't, I gotta go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Come on. An 80-foot inflatable dog let loose over the city. How often does that happen?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Almost never.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Got the keys? or Got the keys!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is cooking Thanksgiving dinner. Chandler is
standing in the doorway, not wanting to participate in the festivities.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan's, Ross is preparing to talk to her belly.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Anytime you're ready.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, ok, here we go. (he crouches down near her stomach) Ok, where am I talking to, here? I mean, uh, well, there is one way that seems to offer a certain acoustical advantage, but...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Just aim for the bump.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, ok, ok, ok, here goes. You know, I, you know, can't do this. Uh, this is too weird. I feel stupid.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: So don't do it, it's fine. You don't have to do it just because Susan does it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (quickly talking) Hello, baby. Hello, hello.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan's, Ross is preparing to talk to her belly.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the group is coming back from the roof.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I loved the moment when you first saw the giant dog shadow all over the park.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but did they have to shoot him down? I mean, that was just mean.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok, right about now the turkey should be crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Why are we standing here?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We're waiting for you to open the door. You got the keys.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No I don't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, you do. When we left, you said, "got the keys."

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No I didn't. I asked, "got the ke-eys?"

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, no, no, you said, "got the keys".

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Do either of you have the keys?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (panicked) The oven is on.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I gotta get my ticket!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, we have a copy of your key.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well then get it, get it!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That tone will not make me go any faster.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (angry) Joey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That one will.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the group is coming back from the roof.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan's, Carol is reading, Ross is talking to her stomach.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And everyone's telling me, you gotta pick a major, you gotta pick a major. So, on a dare, I picked paleontology. And you have no idea what I'm saying, because, let's face it, you're a fetus. You're just happy you don't have gills anymore.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Look, you don't have to talk to it. You can sing to it if you want.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, please. I am not singing to your stomach, ok?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Hi, how's it goin?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Shh! (singing) Here we come, walkin' down the street, get the funniest looks from, everyone we meet. Hey, hey ! (to Carol) Hey, uh, did you just feel that?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I did.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Does it always, uh--?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: No, no that was the first.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Keep singing! Keep singing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (singing) Hey, hey, you're my baby, and I can't wait to meet you. When you come out I'll buy you a bagel, and then we'll go to the zoo .

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: I felt it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (singin) Hey, hey, I'm your daddy. I'm the one without any breasts .

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan's, Carol is reading, Ross is talking to her stomach.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey has a tray full of keys, and is trying each one in the lock.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nope, not that one.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Can you go any faster with that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, I got one keyhole and about a zillion keys. You do the math.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why do you guys have so many keys in there anyway?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) For an emergency just like this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (grabs Chandler by the shirt) All right, listen, smirky. If it wasn't for you and your stupid balloon, I would be on a plane watching a woman do this (makes a gesture like a stewardess pointing out exits) right now. But I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I swear you said you had the keys.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I didn't. I wouldn't say I had the keys unless I had the keys, and I obviously didn't have the keys.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, ok, that's it. Enough with the keys. No one say keys.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why would I have the keys?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Aside from the fact that you said you had them?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: But I didn't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, you should have.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Because!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Because!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why? Because everything is my responsibility? Isn't it enough that I'm making Thanksgiving dinner for everyone? You know, everyone wants a different kind of potatoes, so I'm making different kinds of potatoes. Does anybody care what kind of potatoes I want? Nooooo, no, no! (starting to cry) Just as long as Phoebe gets her peas and onions, and Mario gets his tots, and it's my first Thanksgiving, and it's all burned, and, and I... I...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, Monica, only dogs can hear you now, so, look, the door's open. Here we go.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, the turkey's burnt. (checking pots) Potatoes are ruined, potatoes are ruined, potatoes are ruined.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Here we come, walkin' down the—this doesn't smell like Mom's.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, it doesn't, does it? But you wanted lumps, Ross? (picks up the pan of badly burnt potatoes) Well, here you go, buddy, ya got one.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, god, this is great! The plane is gone, so it looks like I'm stuck here with you guys.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, we all had better plans. This was nobody's first choice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, really? So why was I busting my ass to make this delicious Thanksgiving dinner?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You call that delicious?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Stop it, stop it, stop it!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Now this feels like Thanksgiving.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ugly Naked Guy's taking his turkey out of the oven. Oh my god. He's not alone. Ugly Naked Guy's having Thanksgiving dinner with Ugly Naked Gal.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I've gotta see this. All right Ugly Naked Guy!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ooh, Ugly Naked Dancing!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's nice that he has someone.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Shall I carve?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: By all means.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, who wants light cheese, and who wants dark cheese?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't even wanna know about the dark cheese.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (holding sandwich) Does anybody wanna split this with me?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, I will.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, you guys have to make a wish.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Make a wish?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Come on, you know, Thanksgiving. Ooh, you got the bigger half. What'd you wish for?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The bigger half.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'd like to propose a toast. Little toast here, ding ding. I know this isn't the kind of Thanksgiving that all of you all planned, but for me, this has been really great, you know, I think because it didn't involve divorce or projectile vomiting. Anyway, I was just thinking, I mean, if you'd gone to Vail, and if you guys'd been with your family, if you didn't have syphilis and stuff, we wouldn't be all together, you know? So I guess what I'm trying to say is that I'm very thankful that all of your Thanksgivings sucked.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: That's so sweet.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And hey, here's to a lousy Christmas.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And a crappy New Year.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Here, here!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey has a tray full of keys, and is trying each one in the lock.]
